Rather oddly Gov's press release doesn't make a single mention of the local community group, @CleanIlkley who's idea this was and who's achievement this actually is.

Why would that be @pow_rebecca @EnvAgency @NFUtweets @YorksWildlife @YorkshireWater?

https://t.co/7tsiP8dU5w
@EnvAgency #floodwarning for south #Worcester. Time to activate your home/ business emergency plans and install #propertyfloodresilience #PFR now!

A major milestone has been achieved - Mytholmroyd's new flood defences are ready for winter to better protect 400 homes & businesses.

Thank you to the local community for their patience during the construction of this important & complex ¬£41m scheme.

https://t.co/RBitmIFTRX https://t.co/ygj1bskYIv

tweets.text:
Calling all #Christmas cooks & pot washers!

If you‚Äôre cooking or doing the dishes this festive season take 3 easy steps:

üçóPour leftover cooking fats into a heat proof container          

üçóüçóLeave to cool

üçóüçóüçóScrape into the food waste recycling or bin

#DontFeedAFatberg https://t.co/g4PL47G7X4

tweets.text: @AldiUK #newquayaldi The is wholly unacceptable, there should be regular checks and a cleaning operation to remove this from Aldi Newquay car park. #notgoodenough @CornwallLive @NewquayCouncil @BBCCornwall @2minbeachclean @CarveMag @EnvAgency @CornwallCouncil @BeachGuardian https://t.co/G56vNQQiks

‚ÄúThe #RiverWharfe is a heartening example of local communities embracing their natural environment, and we look forward to the challenge of working with partners to improve the river to bathing waters standard.‚Äù - @EmmaHowardBoyd 

(3/3)

‚ÄúWhile designation will be a catalyst for change, experience shows it takes time to identify how to meet the required standards and we need financial investment and cooperation to make it happen." - @EmmaHowardBoyd 

(2/3)

#RiverWharfe

Our Chair @EmmaHowardBoyd‚Äôs full statement on part of the #RiverWharfe becoming a designated bathing water:

‚ÄúToday‚Äôs landmark decision to designate a river as a bathing water marks a first for England and could lead to a step change for water quality in the River Wharfe."

(1/3)
@aBugBlog @EnvAgencyYNE Thats correct, signs of water voles, dabchick, large flock of house sparrow and double figure of mallard and moorhen.
@SpurnAndyG @EnvAgencyYNE Barmston Drain?

Don‚Äôt feed a fatberg this festive season-when hot fat, oil & grease cools it forms a solid mass which can build up inside pipes. Leave them to cool then scrape into the food waste or bin instead. 
 
Blocked pipes can cause flooding & pollute our beautiful beaches & countryside https://t.co/0li5vuFJIb
@planlaufterrain @EnvAgency I don't think so. Much of this area was under the sea 400-500 years ago. I cannot find any info, but the area has been used by the military, so it may be bombs or shells.

Loving my photo from Team @EnvAgencyYNE today, a nice socially distanced Mytholmroyd meet to check out the tail end of the scheme, we're almost there! @PaulSwaz @ScottAPatient @cathseal1 @Calderdale @VolkerStevinUK @johncurtinEA https://t.co/o62lH8xeCF

tweets.text: As 2020 nears to a close we would like to show the progress and achievements being made onsite at Stokesley #Flood Alleviation Scheme. The ¬£3.7m project is part of the current 6 year capital investment programme and will improve protection to 509 properties in the town https://t.co/0MuTb5ZtGX

entity.name: Christmas
entity.description: This entity includes all conversations for Christmas for all years.

tweets.text:
#Somerset levels & Moors: The Met office have issued a yellow warning for rain across the South West tomorrow.
We are moving our temporary pumps to Currymoor, ready to pump water off the moors when needed over the Christmas period & when levels in the River Tone allow
#Floodaware https://t.co/xaTDDb91qq
The helicopter has arrived and ballast is now being dropped in to the Canal to try and stem the flow from the breach. @CRTYorkshireNE @EnvAgencyYNE @kiergroup @ERfloodrisk https://t.co/NZ7bhmAVg4

Next phase of works at Cowick now already underway as helicopter continues its task with a haul road being installed to get machinery and materials across to the work area. @EnvAgencyYNE @kiergroup @CRTYorkshireNE @ERfloodrisk https://t.co/psvB4XAJYh
The #Worcester field team are deploying the temporary flood barrier at Beales Corner #Bewdley #Worcestershire @EnvAgencyMids @WorcsTravel #covidsafe https://t.co/IpNqqiqecZ

tweets.text: 25 page report written and researched by local volunteers on the causes, effects and solutions for flooding in @LowdhamParish about to be distributed. Foreword by our MP @RobertJenrick @NottsCC @EnvAgencyMids @viaeastmidlands @NatFloodForum @TVIDBOLD @Trent_R_Trust @PeterTCross https://t.co/sxU8vqaqFw
@EnvAgencyYNE @johncurtinEA @Calderdale @mrsk3r @ScottAPatient @EnvAgency @CanalRiverTrust @slowtheflow_UK @AdamBaylissEA Why is there sheet pile coming out of the bridge pier?

In January @thetrentvalley will be digging temporary test pits across the #BurtonWashlands #BurtonUponTrent to help inform biodiversity proposals with @EnvAgencyMids & @eaststaffsbc. Find out more on our website at https://t.co/JJIcU3M5dy https://t.co/JVcRRo1Zyl
